entry.title: EU border mission monitors hold high-level talks in Yerevan

media:group.media:title: EU border mission monitors hold high-level talks in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
üìçA 40-member EU civilian mission to the Armenia-Azerbaijan border met today with Armenian Defense Minister Suren Papikyan. üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan wrote on Twitter that Armenia is waiting for Azerbaijan‚Äôs response to an Armenian government proposal to open three checkpoints on the Armenia-Azerbaijan border. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry reported that Azerbaijani forces fired in the direction of Armenian positions on October 16, at around 6:45pm.

entry.title: How International Criminal Court membership could help prevent Azerbaijani war crimes

media:group.media:title: How International Criminal Court membership could help prevent Azerbaijani war crimes
media:group.media:description:
Christoph Safferling is a professor of international criminal law, among other topics, at the Friedrich-Alexander University of Erlangen-Nuremberg in Germany. Professor Safferling spoke to CivilNet about the benefits of joining the International Criminal Court, how effective the ICC actually is, and how court membership could deter neighboring states from acting aggressively.

entry.title: Women‚Äôs rights champion Jamila Afghani announced 2022 Aurora Prize winner

media:group.media:title: Women‚Äôs rights champion Jamila Afghani announced 2022 Aurora Prize winner
media:group.media:description:
The small, square shaped-island lying southeast to the Venetian Lagoon, where Armenian Catholic monks created one of the most prominent centers of Armenian culture, has opened its gates to the Aurora Humanitarians. This year‚Äôs Aurora Prize winner is Jamila Afghani, who won for awakening humanity and championing women‚Äôs rights in patriarchal Afghanistan.

entry.title: City of canals and bridges hosts annual Aurora Prize ceremony

media:group.media:title: City of canals and bridges hosts annual Aurora Prize ceremony
media:group.media:description:
‚ÄúI never knew or heard about Aurora. I never knew its mission but at that point I was in deep despair for the lack of humanity and I never imagined that there was someone out there who could think of us‚Äù. From October 14th to October 16th , Venice hosted the 2022 Aurora Prize ceremony events to celebrate modern day heroes Jamila Afghani, Mahineour El-Massry and Hadi Jumaan.

entry.title: Swiss delegation heads to Jermuk to survey damage from Azerbaijani attack

media:group.media:title: Swiss delegation heads to Jermuk to survey damage from Azerbaijani attack
media:group.media:description:
Stefan M√ºller-Altermatt, a member of the National Council of Switzerland, is in Armenia as part of a Swiss parliamentary delegation. He and his colleagues have had meetings with high-ranking Armenian officials and will visit Jermuk, a resort town that is still reeling from Azerbaijan‚Äôs unprecedented attack on Armenia last month. M√ºller-Altermatt sat down with CivilNet to discuss the purpose of the visit, ways to invigorate relations between Armenia and Switzerland, and how Switzerland can support Armenian democracy.
